title: Error with latest git-annex version and initremote --sameas

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
In my dataset,I set up two special rsync remotes using `git-annex initremote NAS type=rsync ...` and `git-annex initremote NASuser --sameas NAS type=rsync .. autoenable=true.`, pointing to the same data source, but having different file permissions (`NASuser`is read-only).

Now, when I publish the dataset and install it somewhere else, I receive the error
```
[INFO   ]   Remote origin not usable by git-annex; setting annex-ignore 
[ERROR  ] sequence item 0: expected str instance, NoneType found [utils.py:_handle_possible_annex_dataset:192] (TypeError) 
```
Also, the special remote `NASuser`is not enabled automatically, and indeed, enabling it via `datalad siblings enable -s NASuser` is not successful, giving
```
[ERROR  ] unknown sibling name [query-sibling(/home/eckhard/Documents/Research/DataLad/testdemo)] 
```
Using `git-annex enableremote NASuser` (or indeed `git-annex init`) instead seems to work, resulting in
```
enableremote NASuser ok
(recording state in git...)
```
So, while the problem can be easily ignored for individual datasets, it does prevent me from doing recursive installs.

Is the `--sameas` option of `git-annex initremote` known to be problematic and are there plans to make `datalad`compatible with it?
Thanks!
